metadata.name: If A Rose Could Reflect On The Human Gaze
metadata.description:
Over hundreds of years, humans have cultivated roses to have more desirable patterns, better scents, more saturated colors, and even a more graceful death. By asking the rose what it experiences from its revered cultural position, I want to further understand how roses are using human desire to evolve and procreate, and to what extent we are entranced into performing their desires.

If A Rose Could Reflect On The Human Gaze is an animated portrait using video footage, 2D shapes, and scanned photographs. Part of a larger series titled The Sextant of the Rose, which formally combines animated video with sculptural elements, and includes materials like live roses.

Previously exhibited at:
Knockdown Center, Queens, NY, 2020 
Other Places Art Fair, Los Angeles, CA, 2020
Vox Populi, Philadelphia, PA, 2021
SPACE, Portland, Maine, 2022

2700 x 2700 
9 seconds
16 bit mp4

Dakota Gearhart, 2022
